cover.headline: What happens to your sleep when you quit
cover.subtitle: The science of how your brain relearns to rest—week by week

slides.title: How Alcohol Disrupts Sleep
items: Alcohol suppresses REM sleep, skipping restorative dream cycles
GABA gets overstimulated, creating sedation without real rest
Sleep fragments late at night, making 3am wake-ups routine

slides.title: Early Recovery: Days 1-14
items: REM rebounds with vivid dreams as your brain catches up
Melatonin rhythms restore, returning natural sleep signals by week 2
Night wakings peak days 3-5, then gradually decline

slides.title: Mid Recovery: Weeks 2-8
items: Cortisol normalizes, so stress hormones stop spiking at night
Deep sleep increases, improving physical restoration each night
Sleep efficiency climbs with more time asleep, less awake

slides.title: Long-Term: Months 2+
items: REM timing normalizes and dreams return to healthy patterns
Sleep architecture heals with full light, deep, and REM cycles
Morning alertness improves as waking rested becomes normal

end.closer: Your brain remembers how to sleep—give it time
